name: milkmaid
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in the past, a woman employed to work in a dairy (= a place on a farm where milk and cream are kept and cheese and butter are made), for example making butter and cheese and milking the cows: She went out with the other milkmaids to the cows in the fields. Tess of the D'Urbervilles is a milk-maid who falls in love with a man called Angel Clare. Synonym
dairymaidCompare
housemaid
kitchen maid
lady's maid
More examplesFewer examplesShe heard that a dairyman some miles to the south needed a good milkmaid for the summer.Milkmaids were frequently affected with cowpox.Heidi had pigtails and wore a milk-maid dress.
